definition: lit. chrysanthemums after the Double Ninth Festival (idiom)/fig. outdated/thing of the past/dead letter
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.chinese: 如今他已成为明日黄花。

sentences.english: And space is, in some ways, old news.
sentences.chinese: 而太空，从某种角度说，也是明日黄花了。

definition: things change with the passage of time (idiom)
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
sunset, the end of the road (idiom); in terminal decline/at a dead end
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
things are not as good as they used to be
lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
